comment: HORRIBLE PROFESSOR. He is very unorganized, everything will be through email and NOT posted on D2L. When you're taking notes or putting your name down for attendance he will complain and call you out for not giving him your full attention. Your notebook is part of your grade and is required to be turned in at the end of the semester. AVOID HIM.

do yourself a favor and dont take this class with him. he is super passionate about his job, but he doesn't care to have a structured class at all. the semester consists of long, rambling emails. he also makes a good amount of passive aggresive comments in his emails. for a while, our class wasn't even given a syllbus.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: you can tell he cares about teaching spanish but he often goes on unnecessary rants during class & is unclear about his expectations for assignments. he takes your notebook up for a grade at the end. participation matter in spanish because speaking the language means you're learning it. i would take him again now that i know what to expect but idk

He rarely gives clear due dates or structured timelines, making it hard to plan. Instead of rubrics or clear expectations, he sends long, vague emails with passive instructions. It's often unclear what he wants, which creates confusion. If possible, he's best to avoid due to the unnecessary stress.

This professor is very unorganized with unclear due dates and unstructured lectures. Goes off on rants and wastes a lot of time in class. He is rude in his emails and makes attendance and taking notes mandatory and both will be graded. He wants things to be done in very specific manners and will take off points if you don't meet his expectations.

Attendance was extremely mandatory. Attendance and Notes are GRADED. He goes on random long rants that sometimes take up the whole lecture time, the class is easy, he just makes it hard. Just keep in mind you can go to every class, do every assignment exactly how he wants and still end up with a C. Grade and class time depends on his mood.

Absolutely the rudest professor I've ever had. I am a great student, and he seemed to like me. Participation and attendance are 100% mandatory. Expect extremely rude and condescending emails. Structure doesn't exist in this class. Assignments and due dates are unclear, but don't you dare ask for clarification, because it's never his fault. Easy A.

Pretty good professor overall, just make sure to take notes over everything he says as her grades your journal at the end of the semester. Pretty easy class as long as you show up, take notes, watch films, and participate.

Dr. Silva is one of the funniest teachers I have had since being at KSU. He may seem a tiny bit condescending or annoyed in emails, but I guarantee that is just how he types - He is an awesome guy. He has lots of passion for Latin America and teaching students about it. He also has very few assignments, its a breath of fresh air from busy classes.
Not that difficult of a class, just show up and take notes. Everything is due at the end of the semester, 2 film critiques, 2 essays, and a writing final.

It's not difficult. Do the work and show up. However, he's really busy outside of class, so he's a bit unorganized with the class and didn't create most of the assignments until the last month of class, so you can't work ahead. Also, everything was due on finals week. Still, his class and the films shown are really interesting.

Professor Silva is a very friendly person, HOWEVER, get ready for no structure. His class is an easy A and all you do is watch movies throughout the semester. He goes on tangents very easily and his lectures are super unstructured. He also sends emails that are like four pages long and are extremely, extremely condescending.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Silva is a great professor if you do the very few assignments he gives throughout the semester. The actual syllabus will not have any instructions and you'll have to wait for an email containing them, which can get very annoying. He's clearly passionate about the history and politics of Latin America, but to some it could come off as ranting.

Professor Silva is super sweet and a good person. But his class isn't very structured and you do not learn very much. If you are trying to actually learn spanish this class is not for you. If you want an easy A you'll be fine as long as you show up and participate. He sends long emails and theres lots of homework on connect but not too bad.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Hes a nice person at heart but his class/teaching style is NOT it. Theres NO STRUCTURE at all, doesnt follow syllabus, excessively long condescending emails, gets off topic in class. Seems hed rather lecture us on attendance & rules than the actual material. Wouldnt have taken his class if i had known it was just him praising columbus all semester
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: ZERO STRUCTURE! I took him for a four-week summer session and it was so awful. He didn't give any guidelines on anything, besides a very vague syllabus. He spends the first hour of class lecturing on whatever rant he was needing to let loose that day. He wants you to participate, but barely pays attention to you when you are speaking.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I love Silva. He is very respected and knows the most about all things Latin American. Show up and participate is all he asks. You cannot fail if you do this.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I took the honors version of this class and to be honest it was not worth it. It wasn't difficult material--it was just incredibly lethargic. On top of that he sends you what feels like extended diary entries as emails and expects you to keep them all in a notebook for grading. Then he takes 8 yrs to respond to anything. It's a no for me.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He gives a clear criteria and sends many emails of what he expects from the assignments you submit. If Im being honest some of his assignments did take me hours to finish but an easy A as long as you do all the work. Would definitely take him again if I get the chance.

He's a good teacher and is very clear about his expectations in class, as well as the material he will cover in tests. His lectures are entertaining that you won't wanna fall asleep like other profs. He'll really bend over backwards to help his students get an A, and he's very understanding.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Ernesto is an amazing and caring professor who wants you to pass with an A. Everyday in class was either watching a Spanish film or hearing personal stories about him. Attendance is MANDATORY. Taking notes is a must because you will use your notebook for the final at the end of the year.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's a great lecturer and all around delightful person. You need to come to class, but as far as grades go, it's a do what you're supposed to do and you'll get your A kind of class. If you like professors you'd love to grab coffee with and talk about life, he's your guy.

Dr. Silva is the Best Teacher Ever!!!! He really cares about his students. He is welling to go above and beyond for his students !!! Class break down 1 mayor paper, 2 pages for event critiques, 2 pages reflective essays for every Latin American Film you have watched in class, he grades your class notes! Overall it is an Easy A!;)

Professor Silva is the Boom!!!! Best Professor Ever!!! I take his Latin American Cinema Class. We watch films from Latin American Countries! No home work. Take notes on Films. He grades the Notes in his class. Two take home test and final is take home you may use your notes. One mayor paper. It is a Easy A!!

This was the type of fun class where I never really felt that I was learning anything. That was until the end of the semester when I realized my fluency was better, and I knew way more about everyday speech than I did before. That being said, it was a great class. Less grammar. More culture. Prof Silva is a great guy who really wants you to improve

Show up to class! Make sure you take notes everyday even if it's only on his personal stories, because he always finds a way to link his life to a lesson. Most of this class was spent listening to him talk about traveling to Peru and watching videos. He doesn't follow the syllabus at all. Didn't put a single grade in all semester.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: All semester he bragged about how he is the only teacher who will "guarantee and A" if you do every assignment and come to class. I went to every class and did every assignment and he gave me a B. No explanation for the grade. He does not post grades on d2l so i have no idea what he took off for. Very boring class as well.

Prof. Silva shows a lot of films in class and expects you to take notes.  You can easily get an A as long as you do what he asks in the syllabus.  He cracks a few good jokes once in a while and the class was interesting. Although, for every absence, it's 2 pts off of your final grade, but he will help you out if needed. I would take him again.

ATTENDENCE is the most important thing, if you don't show up you will not pass! But on the other hand if you do show up, you're guaranteed an A. Watched lots of films that were interesting, but you must take notes! He grades your notebook at the end of the semester. 2 easy take home tests. He's a very nice professor, and I learned a lot!

Go to class or he'll send you 2000 emails about coming to class & fail you. We watched films a lot. TAKE NOTES ON THE FILMS. He'll stop them every five minutes to talk about it and you'll need to take notes on what he says. He grades notes, but he only has two test which are take home tests and you can use your notes. Overall pretty easy A.

- He gets off topic a lot - He drags things out when talking - He NEVER puts grades in - He goes over the test the class day before the actual exam - Cares about your grade - Plenty of extra credit opportunities  - Sweet man - Be ready to learn the material outside of class

Terrible. Full of himself, doesn't teach anything, talks about himself or meaningless things instead of teaching. Also, doesn't teach SPANISH, teaches only Latin American Spanish. He tried to teach us Future Tense in 5 minutes during the review before the test. Worst teacher I've ever had. I don't know how he is even still a teacher.
Looks like a troll, is full of himself and how wonderfully intellectual he us. Phoney faker. Also a bad person in general. Loathe him.

A very disappointing course.  Learned little.  Provides minimal framework in which to learn.  Tells you to use resources outside class, but inadequate.  Conversation is make-believe, not real.  Professor is big on self-promotion.  Large portion of the class is him reminding everyone how busy he is and that he is a very important person on campus??

Dr. Silva is a very interesting character, you will learn things in his class that no one else will teach or talk about. He has a different way of teaching and is very unique, in that he allows students to think critically, some complain because they are used to being told what to do. In this class you will be challenged.

There is absolutely no structure! He expects people to write research papers and do certain projects that he tells us NOTHING about. He doesn't even give us a rubric or guidlines for any assignment. I haven't learned a thing about spanish, if anything my spanish grammar has become worse through taking this class. AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS.

Dr.Silva is an extremely knowledgable instructor, not just about the topic of the class but overall life. I learned a lot from him and got to know the type of person he is, a great one. He teaches and discusses subjects that are often seen as unaprpriate.If you want a unique experience and the whole effect of the Latin culture, this is your guy.

Uhh.  If you are interested in learning Spanish, do not sign up with this guy.  On the other hand, if you are interested in the plight of the immigrant in the US, this is the class for you.  What a waste of my time and tuition-it was open mic night two nights a week, and I learned absolutely nothing about the subject I registered for.

No discernable structure, no book, no help despite repeated requests, class too big for conversation, I was told "you know what to do", no I don't, that is why I am taking the class. His agenda is immigration not teaching, but he is the most entertaining comedian! But yes, I agree he is condescending.

I was starving for a taste of structure in this class! We didn't receive one single grade back until a little letter showed up on OwlExpress transcript, no joke! He was definitely funny, though often at the expense of some characters in our class. It took us 4 wks to watch one movie. Satisfied with grade though.

I think Dr. Silva is a wonderful professor all in all.  2 suggestions:  a bit more structure and to speak more Spanish in class--he spoke Spanish for the most part but at times spoke in English--I think at this level Spanish is all that should be spoken.  He is very much a people person and wants what is best for his students

Very friendly, very funny. Must attend four events and write a critique about each (two films, two cultural events), two interviews, must write about films seen in class and through events in an online blog. The class itself is very enjoyable.

Professor Silva is a great for practical conversation class. All we ever did was talk. We discuss absolutely off-the-wall topics. Class is very laid back. The only work was two outside film events and two outside cultural events. Only complaint is he only speaks spanish about half the time (for 3000 level class). Easy A.

Nice guy, makes class really fun.  On a serious note, he is genuinely intertested in the plight of the immigrant and shows lots of films on the subject. Makes students feel comfortable in class so that it's not embarrising when you mess up.  I highly recommend taking Silva.
Did a study abroad with Dr. Silva. Very knowledgeable and was genuinely interested in making sure the students learn something.
Great guy, great class, love the talks ... MUCH EASIER than the VB who's teaching French.  God she was horrible and hard.  Silva is VERY easy.  TAKE HIM.
Great professor, I learned alot!
Great professor! Laid back and highly educated. I learned alot!

Professor Silva is awesome. He has a different philosophy and approach to teaching, so it takes an adjustment for the student to just BE and ENJOY class. I maybe did not learn so much mechanically, but as a person, I grew tremondously. TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

Let me just say this.  I got an "A" doing almost nothing in this class.  THE ENTIRE class got A and B.  So if you want an easy grade, take him BUT you will learn NOTHING from this guy.  I also find him arrogant talking down to us.
Great professor!! Made the class interesting but very fun. Very Nice guy.We watched movies and talked about them, SOLO ESPANOL! haha. I would take him again in a heartbeat.I learned so much
